column6: Mechanisms for seeking advice and raising concern
column13: Wesfarmers' Anti-bribery Policy prohibits anyone who works for the Wesfarmers Group from engaging in activity that constitutes bribery or corruption and provides guidelines for what constitutes bribery or corruption. The Board is provided with details of any material breaches of the Anti-bribery Policy following Wesfarmers' reporting processes and procedures, and such matters are escalated to the Board's immediate attention if and as required.

Wesfarmers' Compliance Management Policy articulates Wesfarmers' commitment to and expectations of the Wesfarmers Group businesses to adopt appropriate compliance management practices, sets out Wesfarmers' compliance management principles and provides guidance regarding the effective management of compliance risk.
column20: Compliance Management Policy, compliance management, compliance risk

column7: Wesfarmers adheres to the UN SDGs and the UNGC.

column13: Wesfarmers' investor engagement approach establishes its program for engaging and communicating with shareholders, including at the company's annual general meetings, regular investment briefings and strategy days, and the annual report lodged with the ASX.
column20: Investor engagement approach, shareholder, investment briefing

column7: More than 90 per cent of the Group's workforce is covered by collective agreements.

column13: Wesfarmers completes an annual sustainability materiality assessment to understand which issues and topics matter most and has the greatest impact on its stakeholders, the external environment and business. Wesfarmers regularly engages with its stakeholders to identify, understand and prioritise the sustainability issues and topics that matter most.

column7: Wesfarmers' topics are climate resilience, circular economy, and advancing reconciliation.

column13: Wesfarmers applies an internal shadow price on carbon to help ensure investment decisions reflect all costs, including environmental costs. Shadow carbon pricing is a method of investment analysis that adds a cost to the price of projects that involve the creation of carbon emissions. This supports initiatives that are more emissions efficient, other things being equal.
column20: Shadow carbon price, investment decision, environmental cost

column13: Wesfarmers' Bunnings launched sensory maps for all stores across Australia and New Zealand, working with Amaze on the map development. The maps are available on the Bunnings website to help customers enjoy a better in-store experience and plan their journey before arriving.

column6: Direct economic value generated and distributed
column7: During the 2023 financial year, the Group contributed $75.2 million to community organisations in Australia and New Zealand, comprising $23.7 million in direct community contributions and $51.5 million in indirect contributions facilitated by its divisions from its customers and team members.

column7: During the year, there were no material legal actions for anti-competitive behaviour, anti-trust and monopoly practices.

column13: Wesfarmers' tax strategy is implemented through Wesfarmers' Group Tax Policy. It is reviewed regularly. It was last reviewed in March 2023 and updated and approved by the Audit and Risk Committee in March 2022. Wesfarmers' Group Tax Policy includes an internal escalation process for referring divisional or business unit tax matters to the corporate Group Tax function. The Executive General Manager and the Group Finance must report any material tax issues to the Wesfarmers Board.
column20: Group Tax Policy, tax strategy, internal escalation process

column6: Tax governance, control, and risk management
column13: Acting honestly and ethically, transparency in reporting, accountability for its reputation and adopting an 'owner' mindset are key features of the Wesfarmers business model and tax governance framework. Wesfarmers has clear controls and processes within its governance framework to manage tax risks and ensure it meets its regulatory obligations.
column20: Tax governance framework, business model, tax risk

column6: Stakeholder engagement and management of concerns related to tax
column8: Australian Board of TaxationÃ¢ÂÂs voluntary code
column13: Wesfarmers became a signatory to the Australian Board of Taxation's voluntary code in August 2016 and published its inaugural Tax Contribution Report for the 2016 year in December 2016. Wesfarmers' tax strategy is publicly available in the Tax Contribution Report, published annually since its initial publication.
column20: Australian Board of Taxation, Tax Contribution Report, voluntary code

column7: Wesfarmers reported its tax contributions in 10 jurisdictions.
